Posts.Content:
Hi. I was wondering if anyone is taking Herceptin every three weeks instead of every week. I am deathly afraid of iv's and having them once a week is causing me to have nightmares!!! I am such a baby about
 iv's. The unfortunate part was that I asked my doctor about
 herceptin before I took my port out and he said that it wasn't for me. Now three weeks later and my port surgically removed...I am now taking it.
Posts.Title: Herceptin and Zometa

Posts.Content: Yes, I named myself twinpeakes with another golfer who was also big breasted.  Now that I am reconstructed, I decided to keep the name!  I obviously do not know how to use the site very well, nor do I have much time, but I would like to be a regular visitor.  Thanks to all that have seen me pop in from time to time.
Posts.Title: Welcome twinpeakes!!!! Your post was hidden

Posts.Content: Thank you for your welcome! I found out I could take the herceptin every three weeks and I am very thankful for this group. I am using the biggest vein in my arm right now until it gets tired and then we will figure something out. It is going well except for weight gain and swelling, it is not as bad as the doctor made it out to be...
Posts.Title: Hi Elizabethcree, welcome!

Posts.Content: I was her-2 positive, but I have never heard of the +++ signs. Can someone tell me what they mean? I am currently taking herceptin and I swell a lot but the heart test keeps coming up okay. I also feel tired, but I don't know if I have lingering effects from chemo or if it is herceptin. Anyone else have any of these little side effects?
Posts.Title: New Herceptin like drugs,

Posts.Content: Hi.  I found a lump that was nothing which gave me a baseline for a month and half later when I found a new lump that was already stage two.  So please check everything!
Posts.Title: I feel like an idoit - update on "found a lump"
